holidays.name: Plimsoll Day
holidays.description: Celebrate the safety and science of ships by honoring the Plimsoll Line, a marking on a ship's hull showing the maximum safe loading limit!
holidays.origin: Named after Samuel Plimsoll, a British politician who championed maritime safety laws in the 19th century.
holidays.funFact: Thanks to the Plimsoll Line, overloaded ships are less likely to sink, making maritime travel much safer worldwide.

holidays.name: Darwin Day
holidays.description: Celebrate the birth of Charles Darwin and the wonder of evolution and scientific discovery! It's a day to honor science, reason, and the spirit of curiosity.
holidays.origin: Commemorates Charles Darwin's birthday on February 12, 1809.
holidays.funFact: Darwin Day inspires many science museums and educational groups to hold special events promoting biology and understanding of life.

holidays.name: Get A Different Name Day
holidays.description: Feeling stuck with your name? This quirky holiday encourages people to think about what it would be like to have a completely different name‚Äîunleash your creativity!
holidays.origin: An informal observance encouraging fun and reflection on names and identities.
holidays.funFact: Some people use this day to prank friends by pretending to have a new, unusual name for the day!

holidays.name: National Plum Pudding Day
holidays.description: A sweet and spiced celebration of plum pudding‚Äîa classic British Christmas dessert enjoyed year-round by dessert aficionados!
holidays.origin: An unofficial food holiday appreciating traditional desserts made with dried fruits and spices.
holidays.funFact: Despite its name, plum pudding rarely contains actual plums; the 'plum' traditionally referred to raisins or other dried fruits.
